intro: Peucedanum quarrei, commonly known as the Balkan cowparsley, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and finely divided leaves. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, a characteristic feature of the Apiaceae family. The seeds are small and ovoid, often dispersed by wind, contributing to its natural distribution in rocky and woodland habitats.
